Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2017 03:39PM Nursingstudent2011 wrote: I guess what frustrates me is the second radiologist that looked over my images seemed super concerned! He asked me if I had the report and I said it should be scanned in the system. He came back out and said the report, "eased his mind a little bit." What the heck does that mean?! Before having the report his attitude seemed super concerned. Apparently because it didn't have characteristics of a benign mass (he listed multiple things that HAVE to be there to qualify) he thought that the Birads category should have been a 3 or 4, versus a 2. My mass was completely enhanced, it didn't have internal non enhancing pieces (fibro something) and it grabbed the contrast and enhanced(compared to not enhancing at all) He didn't blow me off and said that ultrasound and MRI compliment each other and that he is strongly reccomending a second MRI. The doctor that felt my breasts/saw the indent didn't he hesitate to order the MRI. Apparently the first radiologist shouldn't have used the words, "for this age group" at all. It makes me feel like if I were older the same mri would be super concerning. Now I'm waiting for insurances approval.  I just want to say thank you to all you wonderful ladies. It really does help to vent my worries while I play the waiting game. I appreciate you all more than you know. <3
